::Necromancer::

         Necromancer gently used his head to flip Dinobot onto his back.

     "There you go.  And how about you, lady??" He said, turning to
Tavatron.
----- Original Message -----
From: "Carnage darkness" <carnage_blood@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, September 24, 2000 1:53 PM
Subject: To Wounded NOT To Accept.


>
>
>
> ( Carnage: This post is a half rewrite and half reply to FireFoxs' post.)
>
>
> * Dinobot growled as he looked over the scene in front of him, not a
single
> piece of this, once beautiful, glade intact.
> The grass had been turned up and now bare patches of raw brown earth
> literally scattered, the waterfall was now clogged and trickled slowly
> thanks to a  small amount of boulders at the mouth.
> It was all ruined, and all thanks to the Alliance.
> However, the more he thought about it the more Dinobot realized that it
was
> not entirely the Alliance's fault, it was also partly his own as well.
>
> If Tavatron and himself had moved out towards the CF earlier, they would
> have at least been either in the center of the swamp or on the other side
by
> now. And they would have been attacked there then in this glade, which was
> now reduced to nothing other then a battlefield now.
> He sighed in both disappointment and the pain of his injuries, if only he
> would have known that such an action as staying here would mean both the
end
> of a truly magical place.and the destruction of half of his armor.
>
> Dinobot growled as he looked down at his chest-plate and side, watching
the
> waves of mech-fluid as it flowed over his bare circuits and diodes. He was
a
> mess! Even where he wasn't injured he was covered with his own mech-fluid
> thanks to the force of that blast from Oblitercon, and he knew that sooner
> or later he would go into stasis lock.but just hoped that he was at the CF
> by the time that happened.
>
> The pain of his wounds was making him more aggressive then he meant to be,
> however, he was in too much pain at the moment to really care if others
were
> offended by his tone of voice. And frankly, he didn't care if they were.
> Dinobot continued to glare at Tavatron for a moment longer before turning
> his optics towards the battlefield once again, the large shape of
Oblitercon
> in the near distance.
> Obviously there were bots now in battle with that giant, but he wasn't one
> of them.
>
> In one hit that slaging rusty Alliance bucket of slag had downed and
> defeated him.
> Though, he had known even as the Alliance formed Oblitercon.that he didn't
> have a chance.
> Dinobot growled, he never did like to admit he was weak to a foe, but when
> you're about as tall as its' middle finger.you sorta have to.
> He snarled again in annoyance as he looked back towards Tavatron, the
motion
> of his movements causing his wounds to spark in pain once again. Causing
the
> reptile warrior to cringe, bow his head and bare his teeth for a moment
> while he waited for the pain to recede.
> Finally, after a few moments, the pain subsided and he was able to relax
the
> muscles in his chest again, finally able to look up at Tavatron again.
>
> But then he noticed something about her that he hadn't before, something
> that he had missed.she was injured!
> Her shoulder-plate was missing and the circuits surrounding her joint was
> leaking a fair amount of mech-fluid.
> Dinobot looked at her shoulder for a moment before turning his optics
> towards her face, though her image was only half focused since one optic
no
> longer functioned.
> He was about to say something before the giant reptile shape of
Necromancer
> appeared, his huge head appearing right between the two warriors.
>
> Dinobot backed up a step with a growl, yet again forced to refocus his
optic
> to keep the dragon from becoming a blur.
> He shook his head but couldn't help feel the aggression in him rise yet
> another notch at the dragons intrusion, growling deeply in his general
> direction.
> It was times like this that he was pissed off easily, and all a bot had to
> do was be there!
> Dinobot snarled as he then walked around Necromancers great head until
> Tavatron was in his limited view once again, though hearing the dragons'
> words once again.
> However, at the moment the wound on Tavatron's shoulder frustrated him.*
>
> " I thought I told you to wait the battle out in the forest?!!"
>
> * He then thrust a clawed finger out towards her damaged shoulder.*
>
> " Now look what occurred. I did NOT rescue you from the Alliance so that
you
> could be slaged by them again!!"
>
> * Dinobot glared at her before he was forced to take a step back from a
> sudden pain in his chest, accidentally bumping into the side of
> Necromancer's head as he bowed his own and cringed.
> It seemed that yet another fluid pump had deactivated, which meant that
> there was only one left before he went into stasis lock, and only that one
> and one other before he died.
> He grit his teeth to try and force the pain down, but it just wouldn't be
> reckoned with.
>
> Dinobot knew that he needed help, and Necromancer was offering it. He knew
> it as acceptable and he needed help, and even though he wanted to simply
> tell the dragon to bug off.he needed his offered help.
> However, he did manage to speak with little proof that he was in true
pain.
> His head half turned towards the large eye of Necromancer. *
>
> " Your offer is acceptable.due to the current situation."
>
> * But Dinobot slowly regained his posture and looked again up at Tavatron,
> the pain slowly receding and allowing him to relax again.slightly.
> He knew for a fact that he was severely injured and had no hope of making
> back to base without assistance, though, it was harder then anybot could
> know for him to admit that.
> But, now his internal systems were beginning to go offline and it we only
a
> matter of time before another fluid pump deactivated and he was sent into
> stasis lock, and that lightheadedness in which he experienced before as
well
> as the lose of fluid was making his stomach upset to the point of
> experiencing nausea.
>
> Dinobot simply looked at Tavatron and gestured towards Necromancer, it
> evident that he was accepting the dragons help because he couldn't make it
> on his own.and the expression on his face not only relaying his pain.but
> relaying his dislike of needing help in the first place. *
>
> " After you."
>
> * His voice a wet growl, thanks the mech-fluid beginning to coat his
throat.
> *
>
